meanings.definition: A person or thing that performs below expectations or standards.
meanings.sent1: The underperformers in the team struggled to keep up with their colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The manager had to address the issue of underperformers in the company.
meanings.sent3: The underperformers at the talent show made everyone chuckle with their quirky acts.
meanings.sent4: The garden was full of underperformers, wilting under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The teacher worked hard to motivate the underperformers to reach their potential.

meanings.definition: The act of performing below expectations or standards.
meanings.sent1: The underperformers of the play disappointed the audience with their lackluster performance.
meanings.sent2: The underperformers of the sales team were given additional training to improve their results.
meanings.sent3: The underperformers in the race decided to have a slow-motion finish for fun.
meanings.sent4: The underperformers of the orchestra were like out-of-tune instruments in a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The underperformers of the exam were determined to study harder for the next one.
